title_translation.es: Aprende Vocabulario a Trav√©s de Historias - 35

content_translation.en:
To humans, the greatest **enigma** is themselves. They **marvel** at their own **creations**. When wrapped in the veil of time, looking back at the past, it can no longer be recognized. Life of the past is **static**, **immovable**, and lies in heaps. Beside it flows the **dynamic stream** of living life.

Once this region was **densely covered** with dense forests, which were **famous** for rare **herbal resources**. The soil of the terrain is reddish, which is not like ordinary **sedimentary soil**. Once there were sal forests here.

Among many **structures**, this is the most familiar. It was a **residential educational facility**, where **students** received education from the seventh century. There were **accommodations** for the students to stay.
content_translation.es:
Para los humanos, el mayor **enigma** son ellos mismos. Se **marvel** con sus propias **creations**. Cuando est√° envuelto en el velo del tiempo, mirando hacia el pasado, ya no se puede reconocer. La vida del pasado es **static**, **immovable**, y yace en montones. Junto a ella fluye la **dynamic stream** de la vida viviente.

Una vez esta regi√≥n estaba **densely covered** con densos bosques, que eran **famous** por los raros **herbal resources**. El suelo del terreno es rojizo, que no es como el **sedimentary soil** ordinario. Una vez hubo bosques de sal aqu√≠.

Entre muchas **structures**, esta es la m√°s familiar. Era una **residential educational facility**, donde los **students** recib√≠an educaci√≥n desde el siglo s√©ptimo. Hab√≠a **accommodations** para que se quedaran los estudiantes.
